title: Ticket #6614: STARTD_RECOMPUTE_DISK_FREE ignored during dslot creation
description:
the knob STARTD_RECOMPUTE_DISK_FREE is ignored during dslot creation, but honored during later updates. This has the effect of creating the dslot using a percentage that is derived from the pslot's c_total_disk (which hasn't updated since the startd started) and applied to the current disk free space at the time dslot is created. This can result in under-provisioning of the dslot DISK attribute, which then causes the job not to match.

Todd Tannenbaum also pointed out that we should make sure that the initial value of Disk in the pslot should be set only after the startd has done its initial cleanup of the execute directory.
